item.title: 8 Xbox Games With 90+ Scores On OpenCritic
item.description:
Amid the recent announcement of major changes coming to the Game Pass model, including a notable price hike that sparked controversy, it feels like the right moment to reflect on Microsoft's gaming legacy over the past decade â€” especially the quality of its games. The Xbox division isn't often associated with producing widely acclaimed hits, but there are some undeniable successes nevertheless.

All of the following titles are critically acclaimed Xbox games with at least a 90 average score on OpenCritic. The focus is on Microsoft's first-party titles developed or published by Xbox Game Studios. However, a few highly rated third-party games that launched on Game Pass from day one are also included, showing the strongest examples so far of Microsoft's gaming partnerships and exclusive deals within the broader Xbox ecosystem.

Forza Horizon 5

OpenCritic Score: 92

Forza Horizon 5
9 /10
27
8.4 /10
Released
November 9, 2021

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E for Everyone // In-Game Purchases, Users Interact
Powered by

The current king of the open-world arcade genre (at least until the release of Forza Horizon 6 next year), Forza Horizon 5 is a phenomenal racing title, leagues ahead of the competition. In terms of visuals, physics, music, and the sheer scale of content, Forza Horizon 5 feels like a premium release. Plus, it's simply enjoyable to boot up and drive around for a few minutes.

Some gamers believe that Playground Games plays things too safe with the formula, making only minor changes from one entry to the next. But still, there's still nothing on the market quite like the Forza Horizon series, as proven by its many awards. Forza Horizon 5 was named Best Racing Game at both The Game Awards and the D.I.C.E. Awards, while also earning multiple accolades for its visual and audio design.

Microsoft Flight Simulator

OpenCritic Score: 92

Microsoft Flight Simulator
9 /10
8.7 /10
Released
August 18, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
E For Everyone
Powered by

Like the Forza Horizon series, Microsoft's Flight Simulator titles occupy a niche of their own. They offer unmatched scope, quality, and accuracy in their field, in large part thanks to the company's vast resources invested and an ever-evolving nature.

The latest Microsoft Flight Simulator represents the pinnacle of this approach: an ultimate flying sim unlikely to be surpassed anytime soon. Combining cutting-edge technologies suited for educational purposes while remaining deeply engaging as an exploration experience, the game was hailed as a true glimpse into the next-gen future, blurring the line between the real and virtual worlds like never before.

Forza Horizon 4

OpenCritic Score: 92

Forza Horizon 4
9 /10
14
8.9 /10
Released
September 28, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

The previous best (and, for many, still the best) entry in the series, Forza Horizon 4 is considered even more impressive than its predecessor. This game is the one that introduced changing seasons and achieved a level of graphical fidelity unmatched by competitors. Forza Horizon 4 is a true paradise for racing fans, combining flexibility, accessibility, and excitement. Its award-winning track record, including multiple Best Racing Game awards and the overall Xbox Game of the Year 2018 title, helped cement its cult status.

It's worth noting that Forza Horizon 4 is now considered a legacy title, having been delisted from digital storefronts and the Game Pass catalog in December 2024. The game remains fully playable for those who own it, so it still deserves a place among the best Xbox games.

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33

OpenCritic Score: 92

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33
171
9.3 /10
Released
April 24, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ / Blood and Gore, Strong Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is the first title on this list that wasn't created or funded by Microsoft's Xbox division. Instead, it represents a standard Game Pass partnership for third-party releases, and one of the most successful examples so far. As such, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 earns its place here as one of the best third-party games available to Game Pass subscribers from day one.

The game became one of the highest-rated titles of the year and a strong Game of the Year contender, already securing several awards. Thanks to its inclusion in Xbox's subscription service, thousands of players had the chance to experience it, though it's difficult to pinpoint the exact audience distribution across platforms.

Hollow Knight: Silksong

OpenCritic Score: 92

Hollow Knight: Silksong
55
9.1 /10
Released
September 4, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone 10+ / Fantasy Violence, Mild Blood
Powered by

Hollow Knight: Silksong is in the same boat as Expedition 33 . While this self-published indie title wasn't funded by Microsoft, it launched as a day-one Game Pass release through a standard third-party agreement, making it worth mentioning here. Like Clair Obscur , Silksong is expected to appear on several GOTY lists later this year, and has already been praised as one of the best metroidvanias ever made.

Silksong also marks another strong move by Microsoft, securing this long-awaited release for the Game Pass lineup. Still, many players who had been anticipating Hollow Knight: Silksong for years likely chose to purchase it outright rather than play it through a subscription, especially given its modest launch price.

Ori and the Blind Forest

OpenCritic Score: 90

Ori and The Blind Forest
9 /10
8.6 /10
Released
March 11, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Mild Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Ori and the Blind Forest was developed by Moon Studios and published as a Microsoft first-party title, as the company acquired the game about a year after development began). It's a standout gem in Microsoft's gaming lineup and, along with its sequel, ranks among the highest-rated and most beloved Xbox titles.

A visually stunning and emotionally charged platform-adventure metroidvania, Ori and the Blind Forest earned multiple prestigious awards in the 2015â€“2016 season. These included the Xbox Game of the Year at the Golden Joystick Awards, Best Art Direction at The Game Awards, and Artistic Achievement at the British Academy Games Awards.

Minecraft

OpenCritic Score: 90

Minecraft
193
9.0 /10
Released
November 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Fantasy Violence
Powered by

It's still debatable whether Minecraft should be considered an Xbox game, given that Microsoft acquired it for $2.5 billion in 2014. However, since its 2017 re-release, the game has become a core live-service first-party title with a massive audience. It would feel wrong to exclude it, considering the scale of Microsoft's investment in the franchise over the years.

With Microsoft's support, the Minecraft brand has expanded to include several spin-offs, such as Earth , Dungeons , and Legends , along with a recent feature film that became a major box office success. Thanks to its ever-evolving nature, Minecraft remains the definitive sandbox game, continuing to attract millions of players to its worlds.

Ori and the Will of the Wisps

OpenCritic Score: 90

Ori and the Will of the Wisps
9 /10
7.8 /10
Released
March 11, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Mild Fantasy, Violence
Powered by

Staying true to the strengths of the original, Ori and the Will of the Wisps is an equally outstanding Xbox title, developed in partnership with Microsoft and released as a day-one Game Pass game. As Moon Studios grew, the sequel's visuals received a major overhaul, transitioning from 2D artwork in Ori and the Blind Forest to 3D models set against multilayered backgrounds. The result is an even more breathtaking metroidvania that justified its long development time.

Ori and the Will of the Wisps received similar average scores to the first game. Like its predecessor, it once again became a prestigious award winner for Microsoft, earning Xbox Game of the Year at the Golden Joystick Awards and claiming several NAVGTR awards.

item.title: Fortnite Simpsons Crossover Key Art Leak Hints at Character Skins and NPCs
item.description:
The rumor mill is once again pumping out fresh leaks of a potential upcoming Fortnite collaboration, with the latest alleged images showcasing a major crossover with The Simpsons . Fortnite has already released a slew of new collaborative content for its Fortnitemares 2025 Halloween event, and players are once again champing at the bit for an official reveal of the latest rumored content.

Both one of the longest-running and most popular animated television series of all time, The Simpsons made a notable mark on video game history with the iconic 2003 action-adventure title The Simpsons: Hit and Run . Despite subsequent arcade and mobile games never living up to the legacy of Hit and Run , The Simpsons has remained a highly-requested IP for newer releases. As such, it should come as no surprise that the legendary show is rumored to be among the latest pop culture crossovers in Fortnite .

The Simpsons Fortnite Collaboration Leak

Popular leaker Shiina shared a look at the alleged key art for the upcoming Simpsons collaboration with Fortnite , giving an early sneak peek at some of the likely character skins and potential NPCs. The titular Simpsons crew of Homer, Marge, Bart, and Lisa can be spotted, though baby Maggie is understandably missing. Other beloved characters, including Krusty the Clown, Ned Flanders, and bar owner Moe, can also be spotted in the middle of the chaotic teaser image. Additionally, the aliens Kang and Kodo can be seen flying around in their UFO abducting someone, perhaps hinting at a fun NPC inclusion for the characters. Potential weapons and cosmetics include a remote control for Homer, a vacuum for Marge, and mini-mech suits for Bart and Lisa.

Simpsons fans will also recognize a number of familiar locations from the iconic television series, which previous leaks suggested could make an appearance with an exclusive Springfield map. Burd-E-Mart, Moe's Tavern, and the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant are all included in the rumored key art, though there is currently no official confirmation at this time which, if any, of these locations will be added to Fortnite . It is also important to note that, despite the accuracy of older leaks from the same source, audiences should always await formal announcements from Epic Games on new collaborations in Fortnite before getting too excited.

With players continuing to enjoy the latest content additions with Fortnitemares 2025, many are keeping their fingers crossed for even more major crossover announcements to come before the end of the year. Interested fans can stay tuned for any official updates on the rumored Simpsons collaboration with Fortnite and other news about upcoming changes to the battle royale game.

300
8.9 /10

Fortnite

item.title: PS2 Games That Are Still Hard To Live Up To
item.description:
The PS5 is doing great, and the Switch 2 is off to a tremendous start. Itâ€™s a good console generation to get excited about games, but with all the progress of the modern age, there are still some who miss the heyday of the PS2. There was something there for everyone, from platformers to shooters to RPGs.

Most of the bigger titles still hold up today on the original hardware, and look and play even better with remasters. For some franchises, the PS2 is where they hit their peak. While these games may have had sequels past this generation, they havenâ€™t hit quite as hard. Some games aren't even considered the greatest of all time, but generally have good ideas that no one can deny are genius.

Def Jam: Fight For NY

Hip-Hop Wrestling

Def Jam: Fight For NY
9.0 /10
Released
August 20, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Def Jam: Fight for NY is the second game in the series, and it improves upon everything that made the original great. The idea was a novel one in the early 2000s: pitting rap stars against each other in a wrestling ring to the beat of hip hop. There were more fighters, better mechanics, and, best of all, more music to groove to in this sequel. There was one other sequel, but it didnâ€™t do well, and now all fans want is a decent port of this classic or for another company to attempt a hip-hop wrestling reboot of sorts.

Shadow Of The Colossus

A Hard Game To Describe

Shadow of the Colossus
8.3 /10
Released
October 18, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Fantasy Violence
Powered by

Shadow Of The Colossus is a work of art through and through as a standalone game. Itâ€™s been remastered and remade, and each time it is, a new generation is given a chance to examine why this has remained an untouched classic.

The plot is mysterious with little story, and all players know they need to do is explore a vast world, find giants, and kill them in the hopes that this process will revive their beloved. Itâ€™s beautiful, haunting, and a bit scrappy on the PS2, but itâ€™s still one of the most unique boss-focused experiences, and no one has been able to replicate it yet.

Max Payne

A Gritty Crime Thriller

Max Payne
8.3 /10
Released
July 23, 2001

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Violence
Powered by

There are tons of noir cop thrillers on TV and in films, but Max Payne sticks out in the world of games. The titular hero narrates the entire game as he blasts his way through gangsters and corrupt cops who helped orchestrate the murder of his family. Filled with bullets and pills, Max is on a journey of self-destruction.

Heâ€™s not a hero, heâ€™s just a father trying to get revenge one last time through stylish bullet-time action before the angels carry him off to heaven. The two sequels are good, even though they didnâ€™t hit as hard as the original, but maybe the upcoming remake can revitalize the Max Payne franchise.

Dark Cloud 2

Level-5 At Their Best

Dark Cloud 2
10 /10
Released
February 17, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Violence
Powered by

Dark Cloud 2 is Level-5 at their peak creativity, which is wild since this was early on in their career. Itâ€™s the second and final game in the series, which upgraded so many mechanics to make it more compelling as an indirect sequel. It can be boiled down to an action RPG with two switchable protagonists, but thereâ€™s so much more to it. There are randomized dungeons, town building mechanics, time travel, an invention quest, monster transformations, weapon evolutions, and so much more. Anyone interested can enjoy a cleaned-up version on PS4 and PS5.

X-Men Legends 2: Rise Of Apocalypse

Mutant Academy

X-Men Legends II: Rise of Apocalypse
9.0 /10
Released
September 20, 2005

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T // Mild Language, Violence
Powered by

X-Men Legends 2: Rise of Apocalypse is the second game in the series, following the plot from the original. Players can create teams of four when they go into dungeons, and the dungeons replicate Diablo -like action combat. Classic villains and heroes alike will team up to stop Apocalypse, and itâ€™s one of the best X-Men stories told in a game to date.

There were three spiritual sequels via the Marvel: Ultimate Alliance games, which are also fun action RPGs. But the two X-Men Legends games, especially X-Men Legends 2: Rise of Apocalypse , are better balanced between gameplay and narrative.

James Bond: Everything Or Nothing

An Original Bond Story That Hit

James Bond 007: Everything or Nothing
7.0 /10
Released
February 17, 2004

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

GoldenEye 007 is widely considered one of the best Bond games ever, but it was based on a film. There arenâ€™t many original games, so James Bond: Everything or Nothing had a bit of an advantage, and EA put out all the stops to make it a blockbuster game just like the movies.

It featured Pierce Brosnan, Judi Dench, Willem Dafoe, and more. It even had a banger theme song "Everything or Nothing" by Mya, who also appeared in the game. Perhaps 2026â€™s 007 First Light can finally outclass James Bond: Everything or Nothing , but for now, Bond fans are waiting for a remaster.

Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly

Pictures Of You

Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterly
Survival Horror
Systems
Released
December 10, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
M
Powered by

Resident Evil 4 is probably the best horror game on the PS2, and the one played by the most fans. However, true horror fans know that Fatal Frame 2: Crimson Butterfly is superior in several ways, one of them being the core horror factor.

Itâ€™s an unsettling Japanese tale of young teens getting lost among ancient homes filled with ghosts. To combat them, players can use a camera to trap the souls of ghosts. The sequels just never got as scary as this second game. There was a quick Wii remake in 2012, but fans are more excited about the big upcoming remake in 2026.

.hack//Infection

Four Games In About A Year Is Impressive

.hack//Infection
Action
RPG
Adventure
Fighting
Systems
Released
June 20, 2002

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

.hack//Infection is part of one of the most ambitious projects on the PS2 and beyond. Itâ€™s the first game in a quadrology about players investigating a fake MMO that they are playing. Through action-based gameplay, players will look for clues about why the game is causing some players to go into comas in the real world.

Between 2003 and 2004, all four games were released in North America, which were tied together through saves. There was accompanying anime and novels to tie things together as one big media blitz. Fans who were part of this movement know exactly how special this time in gaming was, and how it helped CyberConnect2 gain notoriety.

item.title: Poppy Playtime x Fortnite: Huggy Wuggy Skin, Items, Emote, & Prices!
item.description:
His name is Huggy Wuggy, and he'll hug and squeeze you until you pop! Poppy Playtime x Fortnite is an exciting collab that brings another Gaming Legend to the scene, as Huggy Wuggy becomes the one and only playable skin players can get for the Poppy Playtime collab. As part of the amazing roster of collabs in Fortnitemares 2025, Huggy Wuggy joins the scene to scare and eliminate those on the Battle Royale island, but how much does Huggy Wuggy cost, what does he come with, and when is he leaving the Item Shop?

How to Get Huggy Wuggy in Fortnite

How Much Does Huggy Wuggy Cost in Fortnite?

  • Huggy Wuggy Item Shop Link
  • Huggy Wuggy Bundle Item Shop Link
  • Huggy Wuggy costs 1,500 V-Bucks and is available in the Item Shop until October 30, 7:59 PM ET.

Huggy Wuggy is a rather tall skin, and one whose cute button eyes and big smile shouldn't detract from the terrifying mouth filled with sharp teeth. Huggy Wuggy only comes with the outfit and no LEGO style or additional cosmetics, and players can purchase Huggy Wuggy for 1,500 V-Bucks. However, if players want the full Huggy Wuggy set, then they can purchase the Huggy Wuggy Bundle for 2,200 V-Bucks, which is just 700 V-Bucks more and comes with three additional items: The GrabPack Back Bling, Slappy Sledge Pickaxe, and the Ready to Pop Emote. Here's how much they would cost individually:

Item

Type

Cost

Huggy Wuggy

Outfit

1,500 V-Bucks

GrabPack

Back Bling

300 V-Bucks

Slappy Sledge

Pickaxe

800 V-Bucks

Ready To Pop

Emote

400 V-Bucks

If you want more Poppy Playtime content in Fortnite , then check out the official Poppy Playtime: Escape Trials from AJatMob, available with the island code 7441-2135-1198!

item.title: Honkai Star Rail 3.7 Livestream Codes & Release Time
item.description:
The Amphoreus arc in Honkai: Star Rail has come a long way, and soon, players will enter HSR 3.7. The version will bring Cyrene as its new playable character, who will also follow the Path of Remembrance. This article will cover HSR 3.7 livestream codes and release time .

Honkai Star Rail Codes - HSR 3.7 Livestream Codes

Here are HSR 3.7 livestream codes, along with other active Honkai: Star Rail codes:

HSR 3.7 Livestream Date & Time - Honkai Star Rail 3.7

HSR 3.7 livestream will begin on October 24, 2025, 07:30 AM (UTC-4) . Here's the timing converted to different time zones:

When Is HSR 3.7 Livestream? - Honkai Star Rail 3.7

HSR 3.7 livestream is scheduled for October 24, 2025, 07:30 AM ET (UTC-4) . Those residing around the American time zone can watch the livestream in the early morning, as opposed to Asian players, who will have the special program in the evening.
